== Main Inclusion Report for telepathy-butterfly ==

=== Requirements ===

# ''Availability:'' <nowiki>[[http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/pool/universe/t/telepathy-butterfly]]</nowiki>; Arch: all
# ''Rationale:''
** Provides good MSN support for telepathy/empathy
0. ''Security:''
** <nowiki>[[http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvekey.cgi?keyword=telepathy|no CVE entries]]</nowiki>
** <nowiki>[[http://secunia.com/search/?search=telepathy|no Secunia history]]</nowiki>
** Does not use network directly (but talks to telepathy daemon which uses the network)
** Data processing done by telepathy daemon
** No known source code review performed
0. ''UI standards:''
** No UI, no translated strings
0. ''Quality assurance:''
** 2 open <nowiki>[[http://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/pkgreport.cgi?src=telepathy-butterfly|Debian bugs]]</nowiki>, nothing serious
** ~ 30 open <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/telepathy-butterfly/+bugs|Ubuntu bugs]]</nowiki>: well triaged, all medium or lower
** <nowiki>[[http://telepathy.freedesktop.org|Upstream]]</nowiki> is vigorous
** <nowiki>[[https://bugs.freedesktop.org/buglist.cgi?quicksearch=butterfly|Upstream bug tracker]]</nowiki>: 33 bugs open, none critical; mostly crashes
0. ''Standards compliance:'' 
** <nowiki>[[http://www.pathname.com/fhs/|FHS]]</nowiki>, <nowiki>[[http://www.de.debian.org/doc/debian-policy/|Debian Policy]]</nowiki> compliant
** Packaging system (cdbs)
0. ''Dependencies:''
** python-papyon <nowiki>[[MainInclusionReportPythonPapyon|MIR]]</nowiki>
0. ''Maintenance:''
** How much maintenance is this package likely to need?  Very little, should just come from debian
** Desktop team will maintain this.
